title: kuma-hina_(31_violence)
body:
An [[original]] [[Touhou]] character created by [[violence_kumahina|31 Violence]]. Based on [[Kagiyama Hina]], she is a mentally unstable personification of curses. Typically identified by a blue or purple color scheme, lack of Hina's [[front ponytail]], and [[bags under eyes|bags under her eyes]].

h4. See also

* [[Hata-tan (rui (hershe))|]]

title: charles_(masterwork_apocalypse)
body:
Character from [[Masterwork Apocalypse]].

[b]Origin:[/b] Natural Selection, a manuscript written by Charles Darwin, in which he presented his theory of natural selection and its role in biological evolution. He did not publish the work while he was alive, but wrote an abstract, titled On the Origin of Species by Means of Natural Selection. Natural Selection was transcribed and first published after Darwin's death.

[b]Japanese voice actress:[/b] [[Kobayashi Yuu]].

title: plum_blossom_(masterwork_apocalypse)
body:
Character from [[Masterwork Apocalypse]].

[b]Origin:[/b] 梅花易数 (rough English translation: Plum Blossoms are Easy to Count), a book based on mathematics in yili xue (義理學, "principle study") combined with "xiangshu xue (象數學, "image-number study"), being one of ancient Chinese divination methods. It's writer is unknown, but according to legend, it was written by "Shao Yong":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shao_Yong], a Chinese cosmologist, historian, philosopher, and poet during the Song dynasty.
[b]Japanese voice actress:[/b] [[Minase Inori]].

Also, make sure to include the [[parody]] tag if it's parodying something along with a tag for what it's parodying.

title: huffman_(genshin_impact)
body:
Oh, do you know Mr. Huffman? He's a very strict knight, not to mention disciplined. He's never asked for my autograph or tried to make conversation. Every time he comes to the Cathedral on official business, his face is a picture of seriousness.
BARBARA TO THE TRAVELER IN A VERY SPECIAL BEVERAGE

Those who know Huffman have described him to be hardworking and reliable; Paimon once compared his dedicated attitude as a Knight to the looseness of his superior Captain Kaeya.
One of Klee's stories implies that Huffman has been a Knight of Favonius for at least three years, having interacted with Klee's mother, Alice, before she left Mondstadt. He once scolded the both of them, and no doubt that they were causing trouble.

title: ip!
body:
"IP!" (pronounced "[i]Aipii[/i]") is an Internet culture [[magazine (object)|]] published by Shinyusha Co., Ltd.

It is a controversial publication some of whose articles could promote hacking/cracking, violation of copyrights, and piracy. Although a magazine that covers the same subjects, Netran, was cancelled, IP!, a milder version of Netran, has still been published.

title: leaf_(masterwork_apocalypse)
body:
Character from [[Masterwork Apocalypse]].

[b]Origin:[/b] No Longer Human (人間失格, Ningen Shikkaku), a Japanese novel by Osamu Dazai. It is considered Dazai's masterpiece and ranks as the second-best selling novel ever in Japan. The novel, narrated in first person, contains several elements which portray an autobiographical basis, it presents recurring themes in the author's life, including suicide, social alienation, and depression.
[b]Japanese voice actress:[/b] [[Noto Mamiko]].

title: shitajiki
body:
A Japanese word for various types of materials placed under a sheet of paper for writing, either to prevent marking on the sheets below or to provide a better surface for writing. Usually referred to as a pencilboard in English.

This tag is used for scans from pencilboards. For pencilboards in the image, use [[shitajiki (object)]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pencil_board]

title: blazblue:_calamity_trigger
body:
[i]BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger[/i] is a [[2008]] fighting game created by [[Arc System Works]] and is the first game in the [[BlazBlue]] series. It takes place in the 13th hierarchical city of Kagutsuchi, the location of the Novus Orbis Librarium. The people living there create and study a gift of magic called Armagus, a fusion of magic and technology. Currently, the people of Kagutsuchi and the NOL are after a wanted criminal named [[Ragna the Bloodedge]], who posesses a powerful form of Armagus called the Azure Grimoire. This causes others to be after not just his bounty but also his grimoire as well.

h4. External links

* "BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger on Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BlazBlue:_Calamity_Trigger

title: mark_(fire_emblem:_the_blazing_blade)
body:
Mark is portrayed as a mysterious traveler who is found unconscious on the plains by [[Lyn (fire emblem)|]] at the beginning of [[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]]. They are the first custom character to appear in the Fire Emblem series.

Mark was introduced to give the player an actual role in the game and help introduce players to [[Fire Emblem]] gameplay. This is particularly notable given that The Blazing Blade was the first Fire Emblem to be released internationally.

title: vignette
body:
Vignette refers exclusively to small diorama-style illustrations and pixel art in pixiv. As a feature, there is a composition that looks like a three-dimensional cutout of a part of the scene.

It's kind of lonely if it's just a character, I'm not good at the background, but I want to draw a little, I enjoy delusionally making it three-dimensional, it's small and fashionable, I love vignettes! There may be various reasons such as ..., but most of the time, the things that the person wants to draw are condensed, so there are many illustrations that are spectacular even with small particles. On the other hand, the sense of putting together a large number of items clearly appears, so it may be a good idea to consider it as the subject of the study.
Pixel art that depicts a vignette is especially called a "dot vignette".

The original meaning is a word derived from the French word vigne (grape), which originally meant the ivy pattern of grapes. After that, it has a meaning as a decorative term, which refers to all "decorative patterns" with arabesque and other plant motifs. Then, meanings such as "illustration (as a decoration of a book)", "portrait with a blurred background", and "small thing" were added, and in turn, a small diorama came to be called a vignette.

Source: https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%83%B4%E3%82%A3%E3%83%8D%E3%83%83%E3%83%88

title: lamborghini_diablo
body: The successor to the iconic Countach, the Diablo was [[Lamborghini]]'s last rear-wheel drive flagship supercar. It kept the iconic scissor doors, but refined the wedge shape into a much smoother profile and added even more power. The most famous version of the Diablo is the SV - short for "Super Veloce", or superfast in Italian -, which can be identified by its usual yellow color scheme and large stylized SV lettering across its side.

title: seal_team_six
body: SEAL Team Six is a component of Joint Special Operations Command (JSOC) and the unit is often referred to as Task Force Blue.  Their role is Special operations, counter terrorism, hostage rescue, and direct action.  This unit is tasked with preforming the most dangerous and classified missions, and they have participated in many engagements such as the famous Operation Neptune Spear, which is mainly how they got their fame.

title: 105_lefh18b2
body: The 10.5cm leFH18/3 (Sf) auf Geschützwagen B-2(f) or 10.5cm leFH18 we’re Char B1 Bis Tanks that were captured during the German invasion of France. Sixteen of these captured Char B1s had Germans replace the 47mm SA 35 gun turret with a gun shield and a 105mm, or 10.5cm leFH 18 gun, and the Hull 75mm SA 35 removed for ammo storage.  Production began in 1941 and ended in 1942, all of these tanks ended up fighting on the Eastern Front against the Soviets.

title: type_94_tk
body: The Type 94 Tankette was a tankette used by the IJA (Imperial Japanese Army) during World War II.  The Type 94 although a tankette mostly served as a reconnaissance vehicle and not direct combat, with only around 10-6mm of sloped frontal armor and a single 6.5mm Type 91 Machine Gun that can only do so little.  Eventually it was superseded by the Type 97 Te-Ke.

title: breasts_day
body:
Occurs on [[Father's Day]] and August 1st.

In Japanese, "chichi" can mean either "father" (父) or "breast"/"milk" (乳), while 8/01 can be read as "pai" or "oppai" (as 08/01).

Good Breasts Day (いいおっぱいの日) occurs on November 08. (See [[date pun]])

title: amx-50
body: The AMX-50 was a French Heavy Tank designed in the post Second World War period.  It was proposed as a succession to Frances Medium, Heavy and main battle tanks.  It was canceled  in the late 1950s due to unfavourable economic and political circumstances at the time.

title: tkb-408
body: The TKB-408 Korobov was a bullpup assault rifle prototype by Soviet designer German A. Korobov presented in 1946.  The TBK was sent to a trials to choose a assault rifle for the Red Army.  The rifle was not met up to Soviet standards and and was eliminated.

title: nautilus_(masterwork_apocalypse)
body:
Character from [[Masterwork Apocalypse]].

[b]Origin:[/b] Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Seas (French: Vingt mille lieues sous les mers), a classic science fiction adventure novel by French writer Jules Verne. In the book, Verne conceives a submarine, the Nautilus, completely autonomous from the terrestrial environment and powered solely by electricity. Its engineer and owner is Captain Nemo who, with his crew, cut off any relationship with the nations and with humanity. They live only on what the sea gives them. The food, the raw material they need to produce electricity and clothing, and even the diving suits come from the sea.

[b]Japanese voice actress:[/b] [[Touyama Nao]].

title: lupin_(masterwork_apocalypse)
body:
Character from [[Masterwork Apocalypse]].

[b]Origin:[/b] Arsène Lupin, a fictional gentleman thief and master of disguise created in 1905 by French writer Maurice Leblanc. The character was first introduced in a series of short stories. Lupin was featured in 17 novels and 39 novellas by Leblanc, with the novellas or short stories collected into book form for a total of 24 books. The character has also appeared in a number of books from other writers as well as numerous film, television, stage play, and comic book adaptations.

[b]Japanese voice actress:[/b] [[Furukawa Makoto]].

title: g3_battlecruiser
body: A post-World War 1 British battlecruiser project, 4 ships of this class were ordered but none were apparently laid down before the project was cancelled due to Washington Naval Treaty, materials and ideas meant for this class (alongside with those meant for their battleship counterparts: N3-class) were ultimately used in design and construction of Nelson-class battleships. Even though G3s were officially classified as battlecruisers in design they were closer to what we would today consider fast battleships; featuring main battery of 9 406mm guns mounted in three triple turrets, 16 155mm secondary guns in 8 twin turrets, 356mm (magazines) to 305mm (machinery spaces) thick armored belt, 203mm to 73mm thick armored deck (areas around magazines being once again significantly more heavily armored than those around machinery spaces), heavily armored turrets  (444mm thick faces, 330mm to 229mm sides, 203mm roof), and armored bulkheads 305mm to 254mm thick, with design speed of 32 knots and full displacement of 54k tons. G3's most notable feature (and the one which allowed to it to as heavily armored as it was) was its rather unorthodox turret placement; 2 turrets (A and B) forward with B turret superfiring over A turret, one turret midship (X), this layout allowed the armor to be concentrated in much smaller area than it would had been possible if a more conventional turret layout had been used. For more info about G3s and their design history both "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G3_battlecruiser and "Warship Projects":https://warshipprojects.com/2017/09/27/washington-cherry-trees-ii-part-3/ have decent articles about them.

title: hms_howe_(battleship)
body: A British King George V-class battleship, laid down in 1937, launched in 1940, commissioned into service in 1942, put in reserve status in 1951 and sold for scrapping in 1957. Took part in Operation Husky (Allied Invasion of Sicily), Operation Avalanche (part of Allied invasion of Italy), helped to escort surrendered Italian battleships Italia and Vittorio Veneto to Alexandria before undergoing a refit and being sent to east where she was involved in fight against Japanese first as part of the British Eastern Fleet and then as a member of the British Pacific Fleet.

title: js_shimakaze_(ddg-172)
body: A Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force Hatakaze-class guided missile destroyer,  laid down in 1985, launched in 1987, and was commissioned in 1988 and is still in active service in 2021. Not to be confused with World War 2-era Imperial Japanese Navy destroyer also called Shimakaze (only ship of her class) or Minekaze-class destroyer Shimakaze that was laid down and launched in 1919, entered service in 1920 and was converted to a patrol boat in 1940 during which her name was changed from Shimakaze to  Patrol Boat No. 1.

title: kudou_shunsaku
body:
(b. January 7, 1901, d. January 12, 1979)

Officer of the Imperial Japanese Navy and captain of [[ikazuchi (kancolle)|Ikazuchi]] who made the humanitarian decision to rescue 442 British and American sailors from the sunken HMS Encounter and USS Pope at the Java Sea on March 2, 1942 despite the risk of a submarine attack. Among the 442 saved was Sam Falle, who later became a British diplomat.

More info: "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shunsaku_Kud%C5%8D]

title: the_first_ship_of_the_kongou_from_jamaica
body:
Related posts: "nicoseiga #im3504934,":http://seiga.nicovideo.jp/seiga/im3504934 / post #1528122 and pixiv #39037778

[i]The First Ship of The Kongou Class From Jamaica[/i] (ジャマイカからやってきた金剛型1番艦) is a fanfic [[original|OC]] twitter_bot. He claims not to be [[kongou (kancolle)|KanColle Kongou]]. He has [[hairlocks]], [[facial hair]], [[green eyes]] and a [[boombox]]. His equipment is a gigantic sound system with 40 [[speaker|speakers]].

He is originated from a [[pun]] on Kongou's name, which read and sound exactly like "Congo", the name of two [[Africa|African]] countries (Republic of Congo and Democraftic Republic of Congo). His "Jamaican" origins is an emphasis on his African ancestry, with a "extroverted happy black DJ" stereotype applied.


His twitter account is here: http://twitter.com/Jamaican_Kongo

h4.See also

* "Know Your Meme":http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/1st-battleship-of-the-kongo-class-from-jamaica

title: cross_make
body:
A series of doujin manga by the circle CDPA that contains several short stories and art galleries using series by the author Im Dal-Young (임달영), such as [[Freezing (series)|]], [[Onihime VS]], [[Unbalance Unbalance]], and [[Aflame Inferno]].  The circle CDPA is actually composed of the author and artists of these series. 

A major premise of the Cross Make series is that the artists [[Soo-Hyon Lee]] (Onihime VS, Unbalance Unbalance) and [[Kim Kwang Hyun]] (Freezing, Aflame Inferno) do the illustrations of stories of the other's respective series.

CDPA is composed of Moonzero (Im Dal-Young), Milkcow (Soo-Hyon Lee), and Anicd (Kim Kwang Hyun). Later releases also included the artists Eldo and Bear.

title: watashi_(jintai)
body:
The narrator and main character of [[Jinrui wa Suitai Shimashita]]. Her name is unknown; she is referred to as "Watashi" by convention. 

She is tall, generally has [[very long hair]], and is often seen in long [[dress]]es. Other aspects of her appearance are inconsistent, even in official art. 

In the original novel illustrations by [[Yamazaki Tooru]], both her hair and eyes are a pinkish brown in color, and she has distinctive 'stringy' hair. In later novel illustrations by [[Tobe Sunaho]], she's drawn with [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]]. In the anime, her character design resembles Tobe's illustrations, but her hair is [[pink hair|pink]]. It's also mentioned in the anime that she has somewhat [[large breasts]].

title: midler
body:
Midler is the user of the shapeshifting Stand [[High Priestess (stand)|]], which has hard teeth which it can use to crush things easily. Initially, the wielder of the Stand was unknown, High Priestess being soundly defeated by Jotaro in [[Stardust Crusaders]], leaving only an unconscious body for the Crusaders to find afterward.

Her current design and name (a nod to singer Bette Midler) first appeared in the CPS-3 game of the series produced by CAPCOM. Upon being asked, Hirohiko Araki created her character to complement the game's roster at that time.

She has enjoyed a degree of popularity since her introduction.

title: christine_(housamo)
body:
"A high school actress with a thousand faces, belonging to the Yurakucho Entertainers. Each of the multicolored masks of her Sacred Artifact contains a different person's memories, the Rule contained therein allowing her to re-enact any performance, no matter the circumstances. When playing a role, she exudes a strong stage presence, but beneath the mask lies her true face: detached, ephemeral. She was born for the fantasy of festivals, and illuminates the fictional stage of the App with brilliant, showy color. She has vowed to devote herself to her first, true fan."

title: tetsuox_(housamo)
body:
The Kabukicho Outlaws, a guild that gathers those who have strayed. A Stray Transient and self-appointed vanguard of said guild, Tetsuox's massive strength is obvious at a glance. He acknowledges, however, his limited intelligence, and so, tends to leave important decisions... all decisions, quite frankly... to the one he acknowledges as his master. As if that weren't enough, he also has a peculiar view on life and death, and takes great joy in battle as it is the place he can die alongside a master to whom he has given his respect. If his summoner were to earn his respect, make no mistake that he would work hard for that master from that point onward.

h4.See also
* [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]]

h4. External links
* "Tokyo Afterschool Summoners Wiki: Tetsuox":https://housamo.wiki/Tetsuox

title: gullinbursti_(housamo)
body:
A Transient forged by the dwarves in the world of Yggdrasil. The sword he carries has the power to fell even a giant in a single swing, and a powerful Rule that grants victory to its wielder. It was originally the possession of his master, and is of such high quality that he has yet to become fully proficient in its use. His master is fated to fall in battle, but had they not given away this sword, they may have been destined for a different fate. A modest Therian, Gullinbursti does not wish for the formidable strength of the sword, but nonetheless, trains constantly to make himself worthy of bearing it. He is bewildered by those whose mindset may differ greatly from that of a boar such as himself, but still finds them fascinating.

h4.See also
* [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]]

h4. External links
* "Tokyo Afterschool Summoners Wiki: Gullinbursti":https://housamo.wiki/Gullinbursti

title: tomte_(housamo)
body:
A Transient that likes saunas and looking after others and was picked up by Santa Claus on Christmas night. Due to circumstances that happened when he came to Tokyo he's lost half of his memories. Because of that environment he's 'reliant' on Santa and has self-admitted to helping with that work as his Role. When it comes to having connections with others, he has some sense of discomfort inside himself that he can't put into words. Despite that, as a result of taking great efforts to make friends he often makes unwelcome favors. In his original world, it is said that he showed a great talent in helping with farmers and looking after animals. He's used that to become known as the Santa School's top breeder and highly useful in all its subjects. Tomte holds a great gratitude of debt towards the one who once found him.

h4.See also
* [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]]

h4. External links
* "Tokyo Afterschool Summoners Wiki: Tomte":https://housamo.wiki/Tomte

title: ifrit_(housamo)
body:
"A Transient who works as a waiter and bouncer at the Tokyo Casino, run by the Roppongi Tycoons. Due to circumstances beyond his understanding, he found himself having to pay back an unimaginable amount of debt. Quick to anger and impulsive, the fact that he is both gullible and unable to maintain a poker face mean that he is very easy to deceive and terrible at gambling. To this day, he hasn't realized that he was manipulated by the Casino. He is easily moved by sad stories and is very active in the sports clubs at his school. He is especially fond of underclassmen who are just as passionate about sports as he is."

h4.See also
* [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]]

h4. External links
* "Tokyo Afterschool Summoners Wiki: Ifrit":https://housamo.wiki/Ifrit

title: arachne_(housamo)
body:
A Transient from the world of Olympus. She attends a school in Taito Ward specialized for fashion designers, and she has a very strong artistic spirit. She is magnificently molded from the shadows of the world and is famed as an expert in fabrics, but due to a certain incident she has been turned into a spider. Arachne is always seeking new inspiration for her designs, and she belongs to a guild of expressionists known as the Akihabara Creators. Her reason for living can be felt through her constant improvements for her personal best and her continuing efforts to make her greatest masterpiece. As she is very self-assured, there are many times when she has been seen as haughty. She wants to dress up those with little interest in fashion, though she's under the dilemma over how difficult it is to bring out their charm.

h4. See also
* [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]]

h4. External Links
* https://housamo.wiki/Arachne

title: babalon_(housamo)
body:
"A bewitching high school girl with dark, seductive eyes who always has her faithful Beast by her side. She doesn't even try to hide her disgust and ridicule of men who are violent, oppressive, and favored by divine doctrine, confronting them with arrogance. She has turned her back on all things considered to hold value in this world and lives in depravity and degeneracy. Yet, in contrast, she extends her unconditional love and benevolence to those who are ridiculed and rejected from society as tainted."

[[tokyo afterschool summoners]]
https://housamo.wiki/Babalon

title: jinn_(housamo)
body:
"He is a smoke genie Transient who works at Shinjuku Academy as the assistant teacher of your class. He wears a tracksuit and carries around a bamboo sword to discipline students. He is usually carefree and allows his students freedom of spirit as well. His fellow teacher, Mr. Triton, is very particular about the school rules so they don't get along. On the other hand, he sees Mr. Mononobe as the ideal teacher."

[[tokyo afterschool summoners]]
https://housamo.wiki/Jinn#transient0

title: ashigara_(housamo)
body:
"A Transient sumo wrestler with a dynamic and care-free attitude. When younger students ask him for help, he heartily agrees, making him quite popular at school. Back in the mountains of his home world, he lost to a certain man in a sumo match and chose to quit while he was ahead. Ever since, he has trained ceaselessly in sumo technique and honed his mind, body, and skill. As a result, he has come to be called the strongest in the nation, giving him the right to wear the Sacred Artifact of a Shinto Straw Festoon. He feels a strong empathy toward one born and raised in the mountains who presents a gloomy nature and a penchant for becoming attached."

https://housamo.wiki/Ashigara

title: yasuyori_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.

Transient from Wa no Kuni who is a part of Shibuya Ward's Yoyogi Academy's sumo club. He has a self-restrained personality that respects the rules and directions of organizations and the pecking order. Those in the same club like this nature of his, but they also have thought of it as too inflexible and straight-laced. Of note, he's been relentlessly struck and pushed back many times by hearty and rough opponents. On the other hand, he's weak to openhearted good will and temptation, and he possesses an innocent side that would immediately swear to marriage. He has a habit of moving forward with actions that are like gouging at his old wounds. Yasuyori suffers from memories of his past, and he worries about not having a place to live outside of the battlefield. He has a deep respect for the doctor at his school who is always looking after his mental health.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Yasuyori":[https://housamo.wiki/Yasuyori]

title: nether_angel_(housamo)
body:
"Angel Transients summoned from another world. They uphold law and order and have a strong preference to maintain community. However, they have more humane emotions and thought than people may think. Some may find a bond with you and offer their help. Others may be attracted to you, and choose to be by your side."

[[tokyo afterschool summoners]]

https://housamo.wiki/Angel#transient4

title: ded_(housamo)
body: "An ice spirit from the world of Kitezh, he is the bona fide Santa Claus. He is also the principal of the academy where the various Santas from the 23 worlds have gathered in Tokyo. He watches over his students like a father. But his rectitude is but a manifestation of one side of his character."

title: aizen_(housamo)
body:
"An enlightened Transient and member of the disciplinary committee at Roppongi Academy in Minato Ward, a school with many powerful and influential affiliates. His Rule converts passion into pure energy, and the danger of such power drives him to demand strict self-discipline both from himself and others. He burns with a deep hostility toward those desperate to be liked, but thinks highly of Ophion, who pulls the strings at Roppongi Academy and is equally cruel to everyone."


[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]]
https://housamo.wiki/Aizen#transient2

title: yamasachihiko_(housamo)
body:
Deity from the other world of Takamagahara and Transient mountain hunter. He belongs to a certain school in Tokyo where he can learn the professional duties of a nature preserver that protects mountains. He admires and opposes his sea fisher older brother and has exchanged tools with him, and he's tried fishing through learning via imitation. Since losing his brother's prized fish hook, he's been constantly looking for it. By nature he's largehearted and not one to sweat the details, so he's not suited for looking for a small object. Every time he sees something shiny by the road he leaps at it thinking it's the fish hook, only to slump his shoulders in dejection. Despite that his tenacity at continuing this search is due to complicated emotions towards the brother he stubbornly hasn't accepted. He holds thoughts of praise for those with an eye for enjoying dances and are good dancers.

[[green_eyes]], [[streaked_hair]], [[chest_hair]], [[hairy]], [[blonde_hair]], [[brown_hair]], [[bara]].

[[tokyo afterschool summoners]].

title: tajikarao_(housamo)
body:
"A Transient from the other world of Takamagahara. He is a student at the Police Academy located in Kabukicho. While he isn't particularly skilled at thinking deeply, he loves enhancing his body and is an active member of the weightlifting club. His secret hobby is to show off his sculpted body, so if there is an event where he can dress scantily, he will enthusiastically participate. His very arms, both as strong and hard as boulders, are his Sacred Artifacts. In order to seal their power, he habitually wraps them with sacred rope. However, those ropes frequently come undone, or are soon cast off."

Often wearing a [[nejiri_hachimaki]] with [[fundoshi]].

title: kemurikusa_(object)
body:
Transparent [[leaf]]-like objects found in the 2019 anime [[Kemurikusa]], originally more cigarette-looking in the 2010-2012 ONA.

Several types of Kemurikusa have been introduced, their names based entirely on color, most listed below:

* [b]Midori[/b] - the most prominent, can heal/restore, smells of tobacco, green-colored (has [[midori (kemurikusa)|individual tag]] for the tree, branches and roots of Midori; as prominently used by Ritsu)
* [b]Kiiru[/b] - can illuminate and be used as an energy and heat source, yellow-colored
* [b]Aoi[/b] - can detect water, resembles a fish in shape, indigo-colored
* [b]Momo[/b] - can divide, pink peach-colored; only used by Rina
* [b]Usuiro/Ushiro[/b] - can be eaten and cooked, pale white-colored; Wakaba begins growing one later
* [b]Daidai[/b] - can record information in written form, rectangular-shaped, orange-colored
* [b]Ao[/b] - can be used to create barriers, blue-colored
* [b]Murasaki[/b] - can be used to duplicate objects, purple-colored
* [b]Akairo[/b] - destroys and nullifies the effects of Kemurikusa, infects robots through red mist; [spoiler]created by Riri[/spoiler]

Related to the leaves which make up the core of each sister and robot in the series.

h4. External links

* Medium: "Plants in the 'Kemurikusa' anime. Species and symbolism.":https://medium.com/@nanodesu.hau/plants-in-the-kemurikusa-anime-species-and-symbolism-c9d8b17a362

title: tanngrisnir_(tokyo_houkago_summoners)
body:
"A Capra Therian Transient with a coal-black pelt, who once proudly drew his master's war chariot in his home world of Yggdrasil before a crippling leg injury forced his early retirement. Nowadays, he puts his experience to use teaching at the Reindeer faculty of the Santa School. Still new to teaching, he struggles a little with some aspects of the profession. Although he still secretly pines for his days on the battlefield, his injury ensures he will likely never pull a chariot again. He tries hard to maintain a calm and professional demeanor in front of his students, and has convinced himself that he behaves logically and rationally, but in truth, he has inherited much of his former master's bombast and bravado. His impulsive side comes through when he gets worked up, and he often ends up acting before he thinks. He has even been known to forget about his injury in the heat of the moment and try to break into a sprint, only to be painfully reminded of it moments later. Recently, his students have begun to take notice of this hot-headed recklessness, much to his chagrin."

[[tokyo afterschool summoners]] [[furry]], [[goat_boy]].

title: bite_the_dust_(jojo)
body:
Secondary ability of [[Kira Yoshikage]]'s [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Killer Queen]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a miniature version of [[Killer Queen]].

The tag applies both for when a small Killer Queen is shown, or when "a certain scene from the anime":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fiwcZ0pg3xM is parodied, including the explosion (for example, post #4266019).

[spoiler]Kira can attach Bite the Dust to a person that knows his secrets. If they tell anybody else in any way, that person will die. Time then loops to earlier in the day, giving Kira the chance to find out who died. Events will play out nearly identically to the first cycle, and even if the dying person doesn't learn Kira's secrets the second time around, they will still die. Kira can't use Killer Queen while Bite the Dust is active, and if he retracts Bite the Dust its ability stops.[/spoiler]


Namesake is the [[Queen (band)|]] song "Another One Bites the Dust".

title: gantz
body:
Gantz (ガンツ) is a Japanese manga and anime series written and illustrated by [[Oku Hiroya]].

A pair of high school students, [[Kurono Kei]] and Katou Masaru, are seemingly run over by a subway train, after saving the life of a homeless drunk who had fallen onto the tracks. Following their untimely deaths, Kei and Masaru find themselves transported—alive and well—along with a number of people who have also just died, to the interior of an unfurnished Tokyo condominium from which the Tokyo Tower may be seen—and none of them are able to leave. At one end of the room is a featureless black sphere known as "Gantz".

title: house_harkonnen
body:
[b]House Harkonnen[/b] (/ˈhɑrkɵnən/[1] or /hɑrˈkoʊnən/) is a powerful noble family in Frank Herbert's fictional Dune [[science fiction]] universe. 

The Harkonnens are featured prominently in the original 1965 [[dune (series)|novel]], and are also a major presence in both the Prelude to Dune (1999-2001) and Legends of Dune (2002-2004) prequel trilogies by Brian Herbert and Kevin J. Anderson. The Harkonnen bloodline itself extends throughout all of the original Dune novels.

title: broadsword
body:
Due to the specific nature of the sword yet generic naming convention, [b]this tag is no longer in use[/b]. Prior to removal, all but one image of the hundreds tagged with it were not broadswords.

The basket-hilted sword is the name of a group of sword types of the early modern era characterized by a basket-shaped guard that protects the hand. The basket hilt is a development of the quillons added to swords' crossguards since the Late Middle Ages. In modern times, this variety of sword is also sometimes referred to as the broadsword.

title: gensou_suikoden_v
body:
The fifth and so far last game in the main [i][[Gensou Suikoden]][/i] series, taking place 143 years after [i][[Gensou Suikoden IV]][/i] and 7 years prior to [i][[Gensou Suikoden I]][/i], in the Queendom of Falena (to the south of [i]Gensou Suikoden IV[/i]'s Island Nations). It follows [[Freyjadour Falenas]], the prince of Falena, as he leads a rebellion against the usurpers who overthrew his mother. Unlike every other game of the series, Freyjadour does not become the host of a True Rune.

Perhaps in response to the mixed reaction to [i][[Gensou Suikoden III]][/i] and generally negative reaction to [i]Gensou Suikoden IV[/i], [i]Gensou Suikoden V[/i] hearkens back heavily to [i][[Gensou Suikoden II]][/i], which is widely regarded as the high point of the series. Many [i]Gensou Suikoden II[/i] characters appear or are alluded to in [i]Gensou Suikoden V[/i], and the gameplay eliminates most of the changes introduced in later games in favor of an upgraded version of [i]Gensou Suikoden II[/i]'s battle system. This effort to restore fans' faith in the series seems to have worked, as [i]Gensou Suikoden V[/i] is generally regarded as the second best of the series, with many even ranking it as the best.

title: blade_arcus_from_shining
body:
BLADE ARCUS from Shining is a 2D fighting video game developed by Studio Saizensen and published by SEGA released in arcades in 2014. It features characters introduced in [[Shining Blade]] and [[Shining Hearts]] from the [[shining (series)|Shining series]] of games. It features character designs and artwork by [[Tony Taka]]. BLADE ARCUS from Shining EX was released for the SONY PlayStation 3 and PlayStation 4 home consoles in 2015. The game was ported to Steam for Microsoft Windows PC with online lobbies under the title BLADE ARCUS from Shining: Battle Arena in 2016.

title: peacock
body:
Latin: [i]Pavo cristatus[/i] (Indian peafowl)
JP: 孔雀 [i]kujaku[/i]

Peacock refers colloquially to peafowl in general, of which the peacock is the male and the [[peahen]] is the female. Indian peacocks famously feature an unmistakable elongated tail (known as a train) with an eye-spot pattern in iridescent green, blue and gold/bronze. Their head and neck are royal blue, with a spray of tuft-tipped feathers at the back of the head and white markings below and above the eye.

Peahens are brown for camouflage.

White peafowl are generally leucistic (rather than albinistic). Additionally, there are hundreds of domestically-bred color variations, including purple, bronze, opal, midnight, charcoal, jade, and taupe.

Besides the Indian peafowl "[i]Pavo cristatus[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_peafowl], there are also the green or Java peafowl "[i]Pavo muticus[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_peafowl] and the relatively dull-plumaged Congo or African peafowl "[i]Afropavo congensis[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congo_peafowl]. 

h4. See also
* "Peafowl":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peafowl]
* [[Tag Group:Birds]]

title: ashe_(overwatch)
body:
[i]"My business, my rules!"[/i]

Real Name: Elizabeth Caledonia “Calamity” Ashe
Age: 39
Occupation: Thief, Gang Leader
Affiliation: Deadlock Gang
Country: USA

Ashe is the ambitious and calculating leader of the Deadlock Gang and a respected figure in the criminal underworld.

Born into a wealthy family, Ashe grew up surrounded by privilege. Her parents were highly sought-after business consultants and coaches for powerful CEOs around the world. Though her parents paid little attention to her (mostly leaving her in the care of the family’s omnic butler, [[bob (overwatch)|Bob]]), they ensured that Ashe had every opportunity to succeed. But a chance meeting with a local ruffian, named [[cassidy (overwatch)|Jesse McCree]], and an impromptu string of crimes committed together opened her eyes to her true calling. The satisfaction of outwitting her targets and the thrill of getting away with it set her on the outlaw path.

Along with the other three founders of the Deadlock Gang, Ashe started to make a name for herself with bigger and more extravagant heists. The Deadlock Gang’s rapid rise to prominence put them at odds with the other criminal organizations in the American Southwest; the encounters often became violent. After years of skirmishes and bloodshed, Ashe called the heads of the major groups together.

Ashe saw the potential to grow the influence of all. She used what she’d learned from her parents’ business to bring order to these groups. Her proposal was that the gangs could work together (or at least, not work against each other). Her principles: keep your word, don’t work with the law, respect each other’s territory, and always punish betrayal.

No longer having to focus her energies on squabbles with the other gangs, Ashe is now writing her name across the American Southwest with a string of audacious heists and operations that has put her at top of the authorities’ most-wanted lists and cemented her legacy as an outlaw legend.

Her full name, [b]Frederica Sawyer[/b] was revealed in "the light novel spinoff.":http://www.amazon.co.jp/dp/4094512497/ Her job is to dispose of the bodies that are produced when the various syndicates of Roanapur get violent. She uses a custom-modified chainsaw for both cutting up the dead and as her primary weapon, the blade of which can be used as a bulletproof shield. Due to a slashed throat inflicted during her past, Sawyer cannot speak without the use of an Ultravoice. Due to her emotional issues, she's unable to function if she doesn't have it.

title: d-frag!
body:
ディーふらぐ! ("D-FRAG!", Eng:"D-FRAGMENTS") is a manga series written and drawn by [[Haruno Tomoya]]. It was adapted for a [[Drama CD]] and a 2014 anime series.

After an attempt at bullying gone terribly wrong, delinquent [[Kazama Kenji]] is forced to join the Game Development Club (Temp.), composed of [[shibasaki_roka|a short, quirky second-year]], [[karasuyama_chitose|the manipulative student council president of their school]], [[mizukami_sakura|an energetic freshman]], and their [[oosawa_minami|sleepyhead advisor]], spending his time bitterly snarking at their bizarre behavior within and outside the clubroom premises.

The manga is the origin of "Funabori meme" (Danbooru tag: [[ijimeka (meme)|]] / pixiv tag: 船堀パロ)

[b]Second Life in Another World[/b] is an action, fantasy, harem light novel written by Main and illustrated by [[Kabocha (monkey4)|]].

An anime was originally planned to air on October 2018 but was cancelled on 6 June 2018 due to the main character's backstory, where he killed over 5,000 people during and after the 2nd Sino-Japanese War, which angered many in Asia along with the author's past tweets insulting China and South Korea.

title: in_water
body:
Ambiguous placeholder for those unfamiliar with the tags listed below.

h4. Use instead
* [[Immersed]], when an object is completely under.
* [[Partially immersed]], when an object is at the surface.
* [[Submerged]], when a person is completely under.
* [[Partially submerged]], when the torso is at the surface. (sitting or lying)
* [[Wading]], when a person is standing or walking at the surface. (shallow only)
* [[Soaking feet]], when only the feet are submerged. (sitting or lying)
* [[Partially underwater shot]], where the image is divided by the surface.
* [[Underwater]], when the entire setting is under.

title: murmur_(7th_dragon)
body:
One of the default female [[fortuner_(7th_dragon)|fortuners]] from [[7th Dragon III]].  She comes from the past timeline and can be used in character creation once her class is unlocked.

[b]Murmur[/b] is the official name for her.  This name is used in most promotional material involving her, including her figurines.  

She is usually depicted with [[long hair|long]],  [[blue hair|blue]] and [[green hair|green]] [[multicolored hair]].  She wears a blue cape, and a short white and blue dress.  The colors of her clothes and hair can be changed during character creation.

title: chitrine_(7th_dragon)
body:
The playable female [[lucier_(7th_dragon)|Lucier]] from [[7th Dragon 2020-II]].  Unlike most of the other playable character models, she is not associated with any class by default.

[b]Chitrine[/b] is the official name for her.  This name is also used in most promotional material involving her, including her figurines.

She is usually depicted with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], and wearing a cape, [[brown jacket]] and a [[pleated skirt]].  The colors of her clothes and hair can be changed during character creation.

She also appears in [[7th Dragon III]] as DLC and can be unlocked for character creation after clearing her DLC quest.

title: chelsea_(7th_dragon)
body:
The default female [[hacker_(7th_dragon)|hacker]] from [[7th Dragon 2020]] and [[7th Dragon 2020-II]].

[b]Chelsea[/b] is the official name for her.  This name is used in most promotional material involving her, including her figurines.  

She is usually depicted with [[blonde hair|blond]] [[twintails]] with [[ribbon|ribbons]].  She wears a [[gothic lolita]] outfit with a [[black jacket]] and [[purple skirt]].  The color of her hair and clothes can be changed to two additional palette swaps during character creation.

She also appears in [[7th Dragon III]] as DLC and can be unlocked for character creation after clearing her DLC quest.

title: shenyang_mandarin_text
body:
A dialect of Northeastern Mandarin Chinese spoken in and around Shenyang.

This dialect is characterized by the use of a much lower pitch for the first tone compared to Standard Mandarin. It also makes copious use of a single-word 咱 (zán, zá) as first-person singular pronoun in casual speech (very similar to Kansai dialect's [i]uchi[/i]), unlike most other Chinese dialects where it functions more as a first-person collective pronoun  (like Standard Japanese's [i]uchi[/i]).

Shenyang Mandarin is often used in translations and fanworks to adapt Japanese [[Kansaiben|Kansai dialect]] (analogous to Southern American English in English translations). Japanese characters who speak Kansai dialect are frequently depicted speaking Shenyang Mandarin in Chinese translations and fancomics.

h4. See also

* [[Kansaiben]] [tn]Japanese 'counterpart'[/tn]
* [[Gyeongsang Korean text]] [tn]Korean 'counterpart'[/tn]

body:

title: phantasy_star_iii
body:
[i][b]Phantasy Star III: Descendants of Time[/b][/i] (released in the west as [i][b]Phantasy Star III: Generations of Doom[/b][/i]) is the third [[video game]] in the [[Phantasy Star]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] RPG series for the [[Sega Mega Drive]]/Sega Genesis home console by [[SEGA]]. 

It was released in Japan during late 1990 and worldwide in 1991.

The player has the choice of selecting to marry one of two female characters from his companion party producing different offspring that become the next generation's hero, which continues for three in-game generations.

[spoiler]The game's plot takes place 1,000 years after the time period of [[Phantasy Star IV]] (2,000 years after [[Phantasy Star II]] and 3,000 years after [[Phantasy Star I]]).

It is set inside a massive colonization [[spacecraft]] divided in different sections (or "kingdoms") that contain the descendants of the last surviving refugees from planet Palm of the Algol System. 

This planet was destroyed during the events of the second game in the series.[/spoiler]

She has [[aqua eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]] and [[sidelocks]], [[large breasts]], and a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]], [[mole above eye|mole over right eye]], [[mole on arm|mole on right arm]], [[mole on armpit|mole on left armpit]], [[mole on breast|mole on left breast]], [[mole on ear|mole on left ear]], [[mole on neck|mole on left side of neck]], [[mole on shoulder|mole on left shoulder]], and a [[mole under mouth|mole under right side of her mouth]].

She wears [[glasses]], and when swimming she wears a [[one-piece swimsuit]]. When not swimming she wears a [[turtleneck sweater]].

She is acquainted with [[chitose_(jonsun)|Chitose]].

title: kunoichi_(game)
body:
[i][b]Kunoichi[/b][/i] ("Female Ninja"), released outside Japan as [i][b]Nightshade[/b][/i], stylized in all regions with the kanji 忍 behind the title, is a [[ninja]] action [[video game]] for the [[PlayStation 2]] (PS2) [[game console]], developed by Overworks and published by [[SEGA]] in 2003. 

It is the 11th game in the [[shinobi_(game)|SHINOBI series]] and follows the exploits of a female ninja named [[Hibana]]. 

The game is a sequel to the 2002 PS2 game [[shinobi_(ps2)|Shinobi]].

h4. See also

* [[hisui_(kunoichi)|hisui]]
* [[jimushi]]
* [[kurohagane]]

title: lyla_brangwin
body: One of the female protagonists of [[Phantasy Star IV]].

title: phantasy_star_iv
body:
[b]Phantasy Star IV: The End of The Millenium[/b] is the fourth game in the [[Phantasy Star]] series.

It was released in Japan during late 1993 and worldwide until early 1995. It is notable for employing comic book/manga-styled cutscenes. 

This game takes place 1,000 years after the events of [[Phantasy Star II]] and follows a Hunter named [[Rudy Ashure]] (Chaz) as he investigates strange occurrences around the (now arid) planet Motavia of the legendary Algol Star System.

h4. See also

* [[Rudy Ashure]]
* [[Lyla Brangwin]]
* [[Fal_(phantasy_star)|Fal]]
* [[Furena]]

title: lutz_(phantasy_star)
body:
A fictional male character from the [[Phantasy Star]] series of [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] role-playing [[video game]]s by [[SEGA]].

He first appeared in the [i][[Phantasy Star I]][/i] game released in 1987.

[b]Lutz[/b] is a wise and skilled [[magician]] with long [[blue hair]] and a white [[hooded cape]]. [spoilers]He appears in subsequent games in the series as his magic makes him able to hibernate for thousands of years.[/spoilers]

title: phantasy_star_ii
body:
[b][i]Phantasy Star II[/i][/b] ([i]Fantashī Sutā Tsū Kaerazaru Toki no Owari ni[/i], translated as [i]Phantasy Star II: The End of the Lost Age[/i]) is the second [[video game]] in the four [[Phantasy Star]] [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] RPG game series for the [[Sega Mega Drive]]/Sega Genesis home console by [[SEGA]]. It was released in march 1989.

The game's plot is set 1,000 years after the events of [[Phantasy Star I]]. 

While considered to be very difficult, it is also hailed as revolutionary for its time (released in 1989, one of the very first 16-bit console RPGs), as it introduced the dramatic concept of [spoiler]the on-screen (and permanent) death of [[nei|a major female character]], as well as an "open" ending where the heroes' survival is left uncertain.[/spoiler]

h4.Characters

* [[Eusis Landale]]
* [[Nei]]
* [[Neifirst]]
* [[Rudger Steiner]]
* [[Amia Amirski]]
* [[Shilka Levinia]]
* [[Kainz Ji An]]
* [[Huey Reane]]
* [[Anne Saga]]

title: syd_mead_(designer)
body:

title: peking_opera
body:
Peking opera, or Beijing opera (Chinese: 京剧; pinyin: Jīngjù), is the most dominant form of Chinese opera, which combines music, vocal performance, mime, dance and acrobatics.

Stylistic origins [[Hui opera]], [[Kunqu]], [[Qinqiang]] and [[Han opera]]

Peking opera features four main role types, sheng (gentlemen), dan (women), jing (rough men), and chou (clowns)
